Row.Text: [COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Aesthetics[ENDCOLOR] improves the civilization's ability to generate [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting Aesthetics allows you to earn Great Writers, Artists, and Musicians 25% faster. Unlocks building Uffizi.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting all policies doubles both the speed at which Archaeologists are trained and the theming bonus you receive from Museums and Wonders. It also reveals Hidden Antiquity Sites and and allows the purchase of Great Writers, Artists, or Musicians with [ICON_PEACE] Faith starting in the Industrial Era. Grants a free Scriptorium, Gallery and Conservatory in the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](DE_DE text) [ENDCOLOR][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Aesthetics[ENDCOLOR] improves the civilization's ability to generate [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting Aesthetics allows you to earn Great Writers, Artists, and Musicians 25% faster. Unlocks building Uffizi.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting all policies doubles both the speed at which Archaeologists are trained and the theming bonus you receive from Museums and Wonders. It also reveals Hidden Antiquity Sites and and allows the purchase of Great Writers, Artists, or Musicians with [ICON_PEACE] Faith starting in the Industrial Era. Grants a free Scriptorium, Gallery and Conservatory in the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](PL_PL text) [ENDCOLOR][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Aesthetics[ENDCOLOR] improves the civilization's ability to generate [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting Aesthetics allows you to earn Great Writers, Artists, and Musicians 25% faster. Unlocks building Uffizi.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting all policies doubles both the speed at which Archaeologists are trained and the theming bonus you receive from Museums and Wonders. It also reveals Hidden Antiquity Sites and and allows the purchase of Great Writers, Artists, or Musicians with [ICON_PEACE] Faith starting in the Industrial Era. Grants a free Scriptorium, Gallery and Conservatory in the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](RU_RU text) [ENDCOLOR][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Aesthetics[ENDCOLOR] improves the civilization's ability to generate [ICON_CULTURE] Culture.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting Aesthetics allows you to earn Great Writers, Artists, and Musicians 25% faster. Unlocks building Uffizi.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Adopting all policies doubles both the speed at which Archaeologists are trained and the theming bonus you receive from Museums and Wonders. It also reveals Hidden Antiquity Sites and and allows the purchase of Great Writers, Artists, or Musicians with [ICON_PEACE] Faith starting in the Industrial Era. Grants a free Scriptorium, Gallery and Conservatory in the [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital.
Writer's College
The Writer's College is a reward for adopting all policies in the Aesthetics tree. It provides +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and 3 Great Writer Specialist Slots.
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](DE_DE text) [ENDCOLOR]Writer's College

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](RU_RU text) [ENDCOLOR]The Writer's College is a reward for adopting all policies in the Aesthetics tree. It provides +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture and 3 Great Writer Specialist Slots.
School of Arts
The School of Arts is a reward for adopting all policies in the Aesthetics tree. It provides +2 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness and 3 Great Artist Specialist Slots.
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](DE_DE text) [ENDCOLOR]School of Arts

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](DE_DE text) [ENDCOLOR]The School of Arts is a reward for adopting all policies in the Aesthetics tree. It provides +2 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness and 3 Great Artist Specialist Slots.

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](RU_RU text) [ENDCOLOR]The School of Arts is a reward for adopting all policies in the Aesthetics tree. It provides +2 [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness and 3 Great Artist Specialist Slots.
Musician's School of talent
The Musician's School of talent is a reward for adopting all policies in the Aesthetics tree. It provides +2 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism and 3 Great Musician Specialist Slots.
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](DE_DE text) [ENDCOLOR]Musician's School of talent

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](DE_DE text) [ENDCOLOR]The Musician's School of talent is a reward for adopting all policies in the Aesthetics tree. It provides +2 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism and 3 Great Musician Specialist Slots.
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](PL_PL text) [ENDCOLOR]Musician's School of talent

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](PL_PL text) [ENDCOLOR]The Musician's School of talent is a reward for adopting all policies in the Aesthetics tree. It provides +2 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism and 3 Great Musician Specialist Slots.
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](RU_RU text) [ENDCOLOR]Musician's School of talent

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](RU_RU text) [ENDCOLOR]The Musician's School of talent is a reward for adopting all policies in the Aesthetics tree. It provides +2 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism and 3 Great Musician Specialist Slots.
Tourist House

The Tourist House is a reward for adopting all policies in the Aesthetics tree. It provides +12 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism at the Radio Technology and increases [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism from Great Works by 50%.
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](DE_DE text) [ENDCOLOR]Tourist House

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](DE_DE text) [ENDCOLOR]The Tourist House is a reward for adopting all policies in the Aesthetics tree. It provides +12 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism at the Radio Technology and increases [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism from Great Works by 50%.
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](PL_PL text) [ENDCOLOR]Tourist House

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](PL_PL text) [ENDCOLOR]The Tourist House is a reward for adopting all policies in the Aesthetics tree. It provides +12 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism at the Radio Technology and increases [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism from Great Works by 50%.
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](RU_RU text) [ENDCOLOR]Tourist House

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](RU_RU text) [ENDCOLOR]The Tourist House is a reward for adopting all policies in the Aesthetics tree. It provides +12 [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism at the Radio Technology and increases [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism from Great Works by 50%.
Archaeologist Units
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](DE_DE text) [ENDCOLOR]Archaeologist Units
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](PL_PL text) [ENDCOLOR]Archaeologist Units
[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](RU_RU text) [ENDCOLOR]Archaeologist Units

When improved with an Archaeological Dig, a Hidden Antiquity Site can then yield an Artifact that can be placed in a Great Work of Art slot, or be transformed into a Landmark improvement. Hidden Antiquity Sites are only visible to civs that have all the policies in the Aesthetics policy tree.

To take advantage of an Antiquity Site, you must first build an Archaeologist. Archaeologists are units that can only be constructed in a city with a University. Once built, send him to any Antiquity Site (Open Borders are required for other civilizations), and once they arrive, select the "Construct Archaeological Dig" option on the Unit panel. After a set number of turns, you will have the option to either extract an Artifact, or create a Landmark.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]If you complete the Aesthetics Social Policy tree, you will also reveal Hidden Antiquity Sites. These special Antiquity sites not only yield up Artifacts like regular Antiquity Sites, but there is also a chance you will find a special Great Work of Writing Artifact, like the Rosetta Stone. You can use this like a Great Work of Writing, or you can choose to start a Cultural Renaissance, which will grant you a large amount of Culture.

[COLOR_WARNING_TEXT](DE_DE text) [ENDCOLOR]When improved with an Archaeological Dig, a Hidden Antiquity Site can then yield an Artifact that can be placed in a Great Work of Art slot, or be transformed into a Landmark improvement. Hidden Antiquity Sites are only visible to civs that have all the policies in the Aesthetics policy tree.
